body:
Can we wrap all auto-generated front matter titles in quotation marks during pre-publishing processing?

**Issue:**
Colons are causing this build error:

```
(<unknown>): mapping values are not allowed in this context
```

Pages that have build errors do not display correctly out on the site, for example: http://kubernetes.io/v1.0/docs/admin/cluster-components.html
Here is that page's current frontmatter:

```

---
layout: docwithnav
title: Kubernetes Cluster Admin Guide: Cluster Components

---
```

**Proposed Solution:**  
If we wrap all titles in quotations, this resolves any errors caused by titles that contain colons and the pages display as expected:
Example of frontmatter with quotations:

```

---
layout: docwithnav
title: "Kubernetes Cluster Admin Guide: Cluster Components"

---
```

**Build errors:**
Here are the build errors im seeing during a local build:

```
Error reading file /Users/rescarez/GitHub/kubernetes/v1.0/docs/admin/cluster-components.md: (<unknown>): mapping values are not allowed in this context at line 3 column 38

Error reading file /Users/rescarez/GitHub/kubernetes/v1.0/docs/user-guide/connecting-to-applications-proxy.md: (<unknown>): mapping values are not allowed in this context at line 3 column 34
```

title: Pages corrupted: Titles in front matter with a colon ( : ) are causing Jekyll build errors
